replies.body: Have you received a 14-day ban in the past, if so how long ago?

> [{quoted}](name=Lo Fi Shogun,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=E3x2oEOE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-05-15T23:39:05.848+0000)
>
> About 2 months ago

Then that's the likely reason behind this punishment being a perma-ban. If you had no punishment history I would say this likely would have given you a chat restriction at worst.

But you were on thin ice due to the 14-day ban and the punishment system has escalating punishments the more you break the rules.
Well then there's the answer. You were negative again, within a short amount of time after having the 14 days ban, so it was thin ice and you broke it.

That's you badgering Caitlyn all game and calling her + support names. That's against the rules. It doesn't matter if you've seen worse, it's still against the rules. If you see people being worse, report them and most of the time they should get punished.
Riot doesn't permaban for chat unless you've had multiple warnings in the past. They'll tell you that any toxicity will lead to a perma, and you chose to be toxic. 

I'm sorry your money is gone, and you can try to send in a ticket, but I wouldn't get my hopes up.

> I have seen people type way worse things and not get banned. 

A: you cant tell if they got a chat restriction

B: Getting banned requires repeated restrictions

C: Your idea of "worse" is entirely arbitrary

D: You ignored previous warnings that you would be banned permanently on the next infraction
